intro: Euphrasia australis, commonly known as the Australian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Euphrasia australis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
